name: Copy-Move Forgery Detection
description: Detects duplicated image regions via block hashing to identify AI-generated repeated micro-patterns or copy-move forgeries.
algorithm: Block-Based Hash Matching for Region Duplication
mechanism: Extracts lightweight block descriptors using mean RGB values and gradient features, then detects duplicate blocks via hash matching. High duplication ratios suggest AI generation or copy-move manipulation.
parameters: Block size: 16×16, Step: adaptive, Hash: mean RGB + gradient, Match criterion: exact hash equality
source: Christlein, V. et al. (2012) — An Evaluation of Popular Copy-Move Forgery Detection Approaches, IEEE TIFS
useCase: Identifying cloned regions and texture duplication in manipulated or AI-generated images

references.title: Christlein, V. et al. (2012). An Evaluation of Popular Copy-Move Forgery Detection Approaches. IEEE TIFS.
